column1: Frosinone Calcio (Italian pronunciation: [froziˈnoːne] (listen)) is an Italian football club based in Frosinone
column2: Lazio. The club was founded in 1912 under the name Unione Sportiva Frusinate
column3: but it was officially born on 19 September 1928. Following cancellation by the Italian Football Federation
column4: it was refounded in 1990. In the 2014–15 season the club played in Serie B for the sixth time in its history. The club earned its first promotion to the top flight Serie A in the 2015–16 season
column5: but were relegated back down to Serie B after just one season. In the 2018–19 season it was promoted to Serie A for a second time.

column8: two championships of Serie C2 (1986–87 and 2003–04) and two of Serie D (1965–66 and 1970–71). On 16 May 2015

column1: The true original football club in the city of Frosinone was Bellator Frusinate
column2: founded in the thirties by a group of citizens. The colours of the team were originally red and blue which were later changed to the current yellow and blue.

column1: Bellator Frusinate managed to reach the National First Division in 1934. The figure of president Emilio Frongasse was crucial in this period. In the later half of the thirties
column2: Bellator Frusinate disbanded
column3: and was replaced by FF.GG. Frosinone which played its football in an interprovincial tournament.

column2: struck by a Cosenza player
column3: fell to the ground and was booed until the end of the game. Several episodes of violence then took place and the game was transformed into a "western". After leaving the stadium
column4: the referee was chased for a few kilometers by some Frosinone supporters. Cosenza forwarded an appeal and the CAF overturned the result of the match. Frosinone expressed their resentment against the Lega for the injustice suffered and threatened to withdraw from the league. Following this
column5: Frosinone missed the return fixture in Cosenza and other penalties by the Lega were imposed.

Among the most important victories of the season were the 2–1 wins against Bologna and Lecce and the thrilling 1–0 win against Bari

column1: === From third tier to Serie A ===

column2: Frosinone
column3: under the guidance of head coach Roberto Stellone
column4: was promoted from Lega Pro Prima Divisione to Serie B after winning the playoff 1–1
column5: 3–1 (4–2 aggregate) against Lecce.

column2: Frosinone quickly emerged as a surprise package for a Serie A spot
column3: fighting against more renowned teams such as Vicenza and Bologna for a top flight place. On 16 May 2015
column4: Frosinone won automatic promotion after a 3–1 home win against Crotone
column5: six points ahead of third-placed Bologna with only one game remaining; as such
column6: the club made its first Serie A appearance ever in the 2015–16 season.Frosinone's maiden Serie A campaign began in a difficult style
column7: losing their first four outings and dropping to bottom place in the table. In Round 5
column8: the club came up against Italian football heavyweights Juventus at the Juventus Stadium. Defying all odds
column9: Frosinone came away with their first ever Serie A point thanks to an equalising last minute Leonardo Blanchard header to end the match in a 1–1 draw. The following round
column10: Frosinone achieved their first Serie A win
column11: defeating Empoli 2–0 at the Stadio Matusa. Frosinone went on to pick up their second and third consecutive home wins by beating Sampdoria by the same scoreline as Empoli and fellow newly promoted side Carpi 2–1. Frosinone Calcio were relegated back to Serie B after one season in Serie A as they finished in 19th place.On 29 May 2017
column12: Frosinone lost the semifinal promotion playoff against Carpi

column2: Frosinone was promoted to Serie A for the second time in their history
column3: defeating Palermo 2–0 at home to win 3–2 on aggregate in the promotion play-off finals after a 2–1 loss in the first leg. They were relegated back to Serie B after one season at top level. In their first season back in Serie B
column4: Frosinone missed out on promotion after losing in the playoff final to Spezia.
